Call of Christianity
This trait has no effect. (something to do with religion)
Rising Tide
+1[ICON_MOVES] Movement for Embarked Units. +1[ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Fishing Boats. +1[ICON_GOLD] Gold, +1[ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and +1[ICON_PEACE] from Sea Trade Routes.
Warlord of Shikoku
This trait has no effect. (something to do with bonuses on Shikoku)
Disciple of Bishamonten
Units fight as though they were at full strength even when damaged. Gains [ICON_PEACE] Faith for the empire for each enemy unit killed.
Tiger of Kai
This trait has no effect. (something to do with bonuses to cavalry)
Lion of Sagami
This trait has no effect. (something to do with bonuses to bonuses to defense and Culture)
The Great Unifier

Begins the game with a free Spy, but as the vassal of the Imagawa clan. All Diplomat Units receive +2 [ICON_MOVES] Movement and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Royal Signet[ENDCOLOR] promotion, granting +10 [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence from City-State missions.
Nembutsu

Begins the game as the founder of [ICON_RELIGION_JODO_SHINSHU] Jodo Shinshu Buddhism. Cannot purchase Missionaries or Inquisitors. When capturing an enemy City, automatically convert that city to [ICON_RELIGION_JODO_SHINSHU] Jodo Shinshu Buddhism.

This trait has no effect. (something to do with attacking)
Ambition
Begins the game with Tokugawa as a vassal.
Professional Army
This trait has no effect. (something to do with bonuses to Ashigaru)
